Chat Support:

 Thanks for letting me know! Let's dig into your issue with lost handovers from Khoros Flow to Care.

Just to confirm, when you say lost handovers, do you mean that conversations initiated in Flow are not appearing in Care at all, or are they showing up with missing information or delays? Also, is this happening for all conversations or only certain types/channels?

Could you share:
- When did you first notice this issue?
- Does it happen consistently, or only at certain times?
- Are there any error messages or logs visible in either Flow or Care?

This info will help me narrow down the possible causes and guide you more effectively! 
Carsten Schmitt-Hoeppner:

 we see this since a few days, it is not sonsistently nor in specific flows, it happens randomly. there are no errors in flow, we have analyzed the logs and can not see any reason why the convo is not appearing in flow 
Chat Support:

 Thanks for the details! It sounds like the handover issue is intermittent, not tied to specific flows, and there are no errors in your Flow logs. Since this started a few days ago and you’ve already checked the logs, let’s consider a few possibilities:

1. Integration/Configuration Delays or Filters: Sometimes, delays or specific configuration settings between Flow and Care can cause content to not appear as expected. For example, there might be per-board delays or routing rules that could impact when or if a conversation appears in Care. You can review more about these settings in this article: Configure your community to escalate content to Khoros Care [https://khoros-classic.kayako.com/article/125064].

2. Content Moderation or Filtering: In some cases, content may be filtered out or held for moderation, which could explain why it doesn’t show up in Care. This is more common in communities with spam management or moderation tools enabled. For more on this, see: Community members have reported posts missing after posting. Where have these posts gone? [https://khoros-classic.kayako.com/article/125829].

Since you’ve already analyzed the logs and haven’t found errors, and because this is a random/intermittent issue, it may require deeper investigation by our technical team.

Would you like me to escalate this to a live support agent for further analysis? If so, could you please confirm:
- The approximate date/time of the most recent lost handover
- Any specific conversation IDs (if available) that failed to appear in Care

This info will help our team investigate more efficiently!
